author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: South Korea Baseball Game Cancelled Due to Extreme Heat: A Historic First | Science-Environment
text: South Korea Baseball Game Cancelled Due to Extreme Heat: A Historic First South Korea's professional baseball league cancelled a game for the first time in its 42-year history due to extreme heat. The scheduled game between LG Twins and Lotte Giants was called off as temperatures soared above 35 degrees Celsius. This marks a significant event influenced by rising average annual temperatures. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Updated: 02-08-2024 14:27 IST | Created: 02-08-2024 14:27 IST South Korea's professional baseball league cancelled a scheduled game on Friday due to extreme temperatures. This marks the first instance in the league's 42-year history where a game was called off because of excessive heat. The match between LG Twins and Lotte Giants was to take place in Ulsan, but was cancelled as local temperatures surpassed 35 degrees Celsius (95 degrees Fahrenheit). The Korea Baseball Organization (KBO) official noted that ground temperatures in the Ulsan stadium exceeded 50 degrees Celsius (122 degrees Fahrenheit) during the day. The extreme heat event follows a week after the conclusion of the monsoon season, which brought flooding and landslides to the central regions. Experts and officials have indicated that South Korea, which typically has four distinct seasons, is experiencing warmer annual temperatures. Several regions have been under daily heat warnings since July 21, issued when highs surpass 33 degrees Celsius (91 degrees Fahrenheit). (With inputs from agencies.)

author: archyde
title: Princess Leonor stressed: the gesture of her mother, Letizia of Spain, provokes reaction
text:
Unwavering support was evident as Princess Leonor of Spain nervously stood on the sidelines during her speech at the presentation of the prizes of the Princess of Girona Foundation in Lloret de Mar on July 10. Queen Letizia kept a close eye on her.
The wife of King Felipe VI didn’t hesitate to comfort her daughter by gently embracing her before she spoke. This gesture, which did not go unnoticed, had the desired effect, and Princess Leonor delivered a flawless speech in front of her future subjects, all in perfect Castilian without any hesitation. Comments such as “A polyglot princess who embraces Catalonia and all of Spain”, “Impressive”, “She will be the best monarch after her father”, “Spectacular”, and “She is awesome” were reported by Here .
Princess Leonor of Spain is asserting herself, much to her mother’s displeasure: “Letizia is very angry.” Already very popular at just 18 years old, Leonor embodies the present and future of a Spanish kingdom that has been experiencing turmoil for several years. On July 12, she is set to make her very first official solo trip to Portugal. The princess will be welcomed at the Belém Palace by the President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa.
Princess Leonor of Spain: A Future Monarch Making Her Mark Unwavering support. The princess’s nervousness Leonor of Spain was palpable on the sidelines of his speech at the presentation of the awards of the Princess of Girona Foundation in Lloret de Mar, this July 10. The reine Letizia was keeping a great watch.
The wife du roi Felipe VI did not hesitate to reassure his daughter by embracing her waist with kindness before she spoke. The gesture, which did not go unnoticed, had its effect, and Princess Leonor delivered an impeccable copy in front of her future subjects, all in perfect Castilian and without stammering. A polyglot princess who enjoys Catalonia and any other part of Spain. Impressive. She will be the best monarch after her father. Spectacular. She is awesome. Very nice speech,” was commented on according to reports by Here is.
Leonor’s Rising Popularity Already very popular, Leonor, 18 ans embodies the present and future of a Spanish kingdom that has been in turmoil for several years. This July 12, she is expected at the Portugal to make his very first official solo trip. The princess will even be welcomed at the Belém Palace by the President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa.
Leonor’s Solo Trip to Portugal Princess Leonor’s upcoming solo trip to Portugal is a significant milestone in her royal duties. This marks her first official visit abroad without her parents, showcasing her growing independence and capabilities as a future monarch.
During her visit to Portugal, Princess Leonor will attend various official events and meetings, highlighting the strong ties between Spain and Portugal. This trip not only demonstrates her diplomatic skills but also her commitment to fulfilling her role as a representative of the Spanish royal family.
Meeting with the President of Portugal One of the key highlights of Princess Leonor’s visit to Portugal will be her meeting with the President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa. This meeting signifies the strength of the bilateral relations between Spain and Portugal and the importance of maintaining friendly diplomatic ties.
This encounter will provide Princess Leonor with valuable experience in engaging with foreign dignitaries and representing her country on the international stage. It will also showcase her ability to navigate diplomatic protocols and conduct herself with grace and poise.
The Future Monarch As Princess Leonor continues to fulfill her royal duties and make her mark on the world stage, she is hailed as a symbol of hope and renewal for the Spanish monarchy. Her poise, intelligence, and dedication to her role have endeared her to the Spanish people and garnered admiration from across the globe.
With each public appearance and official engagement, Princess Leonor proves herself to be a worthy successor to the throne, embodying the values of duty, honor, and service to her country. As she navigates the complexities of royal life and prepares for her future role as queen, Princess Leonor’s journey is closely watched and celebrated by all who believe in the enduring legacy of the Spanish monarchy.

author: Airbnb
title: Airbnb.org expands temporary housing support for refugees
text:
Airbnb.org expands temporary housing support for refugees
Key Takeaways
- Since its launch in 2020, Airbnb.org has provided free, temporary housing for more than 210,000 refugees.
- Airbnb.org continues to help refugees find temporary housing and resettle in the US through its Sponsorship Initiative.
- Airbnb’s Global Head of Policy and Communications, Jay Carney, joins Airbnb.org’s Board of Directors.
Key Takeaways
- Since its launch in 2020, Airbnb.org has provided free, temporary housing for more than 210,000 refugees.
- Airbnb.org continues to help refugees find temporary housing and resettle in the US through its Sponsorship Initiative.
- Airbnb’s Global Head of Policy and Communications, Jay Carney, joins Airbnb.org’s Board of Directors.
Airbnb.org was founded in December 2020 to provide free, temporary housing to people displaced by disaster and conflict around the world. In honor of World Refugee Day, Airbnb.org continues to expand housing support for refugees.
Expanding housing pathways for refugees
Since its founding, Airbnb.org has provided over 1.4 million nights of free, temporary housing to more than 210,000 refugees and asylum seekers, including Zyad and Souzan.1
Zyad and Souzan fled civil war in Syria and then lived for over a decade as refugees in Jordan, where life was difficult. Thanks to the generosity of Airbnb.org hosts, partners, and donors, Zyad, Souzan, and their four children were able to start anew in Connecticut. Upon arrival, the family stayed for free in an apartment they found through Airbnb.org. They arrived five days before Ramadan and were surprised to find the refrigerator stocked with dates and other staples for Suhoor, the pre-fasting meal Muslims eat before sunrise during the holy month.
Zyad and Souzan’s Airbnb.org stay was made possible through a $2 million Sponsorship Initiative Airbnb.org
launched last year on World Refugee Day. Sponsors provide emotional and financial support to refugees resettling in the US and help them adjust to life in their new community, but identifying housing is often a challenge. Airbnb.org’s Sponsorship Initiative helps address this barrier by providing grants for housing support to select refugee-focused nonprofit organizations that connect newcomers with sponsors in the US.
The sponsorship group supporting Zyad and Souzan has helped them transition to life in a new place. Led by Sue and Mike Sames in partnership with
Integrated Refugee & Immigrant Services (IRIS), a Connecticut-based nonprofit, the group has helped them fill out essential paperwork, enroll the children in school, apply for jobs, and secure permanent housing.
Airbnb.org’s work with refugees like Zyad and Souzan would not be possible without the support of Airbnb hosts, partner organizations, and donors. To date, over 43,000 hosts across 167 countries have opted in to welcome refugees in need through Airbnb.org.
Jay Carney joins Airbnb.org’s Board of Directors
As Airbnb.org continues to scale its work with refugees and others displaced around the world, Airbnb.org is excited to welcome Jay Carney, Global Head of Policy and Communications at Airbnb, on its Board of Directors. Consisting of seven leaders spanning the technology, design, nonprofit, academic, and global humanitarian sectors, Airbnb.org’s
Board of Directors guide its work and mission.
Jay brings a wealth of experience in both the public and private sector. Prior to joining Airbnb, Jay established and led Amazon’s Global Corporate Affairs organization for seven years, overseeing public policy, communications, and community engagement, including investments in affordable housing, disaster response, and refugee relief. He joined Amazon from the White House, where he served as press secretary to President Obama from 2011 to 2014 and, before that, as director of communications for then-Vice President Joe Biden. Jay also sits on the board of the Urban Institute, a research organization focused on housing and equity, as well as Human Rights First, which supports asylum-seekers and combats violent extremism and human rights abuses worldwide.
“Airbnb.org is a powerful example of how technology can be a force for good. I’m honored to be part of Airbnb.org’s efforts to support communities in times of crisis by providing people free, temporary housing as they rebuild their lives.”
—Jay Carney, Head of Policy and Communications at Airbnb and Airbnb.org Board Member
Supporting Airbnb.org’s work with refugees
As a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, Airbnb.org relies heavily on the generosity of donors and its broader community to continue providing temporary housing to families like Zyad and Souzan. You can support Airbnb.org’s work by
donating to Airbnb.org.

author: Wojciech Zylm
title: Munich Re Pioneers Parametric Insurance Solutions for Natural Catastrophes
text:
In a significant move that underscores the growing importance of innovative insurance solutions in the face of escalating climate-related risks, Munich Re, a titan in the reinsurance industry, has unveiled its latest strategic initiative. The company has established a global parametric team dedicated to fine-tuning natural catastrophe risk transfer solutions. This move is not just a testament to Munich Re's commitment to leadership in the reinsurance market but also a clear signal of the sector's dynamic shift towards parametric insurance solutions. With the recent appointment of Oliver Kaufmann as Senior Underwriter at Munich Re in Japan, the company is not only bolstering its expertise but also its geographic footprint, especially in regions vulnerable to natural catastrophes.
The Dawn of a New Era in Catastrophe Risk Management
Parametric insurance represents a paradigm shift in how we approach risk management for natural disasters. Unlike traditional insurance, which typically involves assessing and compensating for losses after they occur, parametric solutions offer a proactive approach. These innovative insurance products trigger payouts based on predefined parameters, such as the magnitude of an earthquake or the speed of a cyclone, ensuring swift post-disaster liquidity. This is particularly critical in regions like Southeast Asia, where the insurance penetration rates are alarmingly low, especially in the agricultural sector. In these areas, the aftermath of a natural catastrophe can be devastating, with many farmers lacking the necessary financial protection against such unpredictable events.
Expanding Horizons: Munich Re's Strategic Focus on Asia
Munich Re's recent endeavors, including the formation of the global parametric team and the strategic placement of Oliver Kaufmann in Japan, signal a focused effort to address the unique challenges faced by regions vulnerable to climate risks. Kaufmann, whose career at New Reinsurance Company Ltd. (NewRe) spanned a decade across various pivotal roles, brings a wealth of experience and insight into the parametric insurance market. His expertise will be instrumental in Munich Re's quest to educate and provide effective risk transfer solutions to the agricultural markets in East Asia, including South Korea, Japan, and China. The region's increasing exposure to climate risks makes it a critical area for the deployment of parametric insurance solutions, which can offer a lifeline to those affected by natural catastrophes.
Munich Re's Vision for the Future of Insurance
The formation of Munich Re's global parametric team and the strategic appointment of Oliver Kaufmann underscore the company's vision for the future of insurance. By focusing on parametric solutions for natural catastrophe risk transfer, Munich Re is not only addressing the immediate needs for post-catastrophe liquidity but also pioneering a shift towards more resilient and sustainable risk management practices. This initiative reflects a broader trend in the reinsurance industry towards embracing innovative solutions that can meet the challenges posed by a changing climate. As the market for parametric insurance continues to evolve, Munich Re's efforts in regions like Southeast Asia could play a pivotal role in shaping the future of global risk management.
In conclusion, Munich Re's establishment of a global parametric team, coupled with the strategic appointment of Oliver Kaufmann in Japan, marks a significant milestone in the reinsurance industry's journey towards innovative and sustainable risk management solutions. By focusing on the dynamic and still-evolving market for parametric natural catastrophe risk transfer solutions, Munich Re is not only demonstrating its leadership in the reinsurance sector but also its commitment to addressing the pressing challenges posed by climate change. As the company continues to expand its presence and expertise in the parametric insurance market, its efforts could herald a new era of resilience and protection for vulnerable regions across the globe.

organizations.name: munich re pioneers parametric insurance solutions

author: Redacción
title: Bajas temperaturas y heladas afectarán a San Luis Potosí por el frente frío No. 14
text:
Bajas temperaturas y heladas afectarán a San Luis Potosí por el frente frío No. 14
Se esperan bajas temperaturas, heladas y vientos fuertes en las próximas horas
San Luis Potosí se prepara para la llegada del Frente Frío No. 14, el cual traerá consigo un evento de Norte muy fuerte en las próximas horas, afectando a varias regiones del país, incluida la entidad potosina. Según el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN), la masa de aire polar asociada a este frente mantendrá temperaturas bajas a muy frías, especialmente durante las mañanas y noches.
Se espera que las temperaturas en las zonas altas de San Luis Potosí desciendan entre los -5 y 0 grados Celsius, con probabilidad de heladas, lo que pone en alerta a las autoridades y ciudadanos. Además, se reporta que los vientos del Norte soplarán con rachas de entre 30 y 50 km/h, lo que podría generar condiciones de incomodidad y afectación en algunas áreas. Las rachas más intensas se presentarán en la región del Istmo y Golfo de Tehuantepec, pero también se podrían sentir en el resto del estado.
El pronóstico también advierte sobre posibles lluvias aisladas en algunas zonas de la región, producto de los canales de baja presión en el sureste y oriente del país. En consecuencia, las autoridades sugieren a la población que tome precauciones, especialmente durante las horas de frío intenso, y se mantenga informada sobre las actualizaciones meteorológicas.
Se recomienda que los potosinos se abriguen adecuadamente, eviten los cambios bruscos de temperatura y brinden especial atención a niños y personas mayores. Además, se exhorta a extremar precauciones por los vientos fuertes y posibles deslaves e inundaciones en las zonas bajas de la región.
Para mantenerse al tanto de la situación, la población puede consultar los pronósticos y avisos del SMN y la Conagua a través de sus plataformas digitales y redes sociales.

author: Manish Gajbhiye
title: Relief From Scorching Heat As Heavy Rains Hit Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar
text: The citizens of Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar and the surrounding areas were relieved from the scorching heat by the much-awaited rain on Sunday afternoon. Heavy rain accompanied by strong winds was reported, with a total rainfall of 11.4 mm recorded at the observatories. The temperature dropped from around 36 degrees Celsius in the past few days to 31.4 degrees Celsius, marking the lowest temperature recorded in June this year. Compared to the last six days, the temperature fell by 3.6 degrees Celsius. The city was covered with clouds since Sunday morning. A blackout occurred in the afternoon, followed by heavy rain and storms for about half an hour. The air felt chilly due to the rain, and the maximum temperature recorded was 31.4 degrees Celsius. On June 1, the temperature had reached 40 degrees Celsius. Experts have predicted that small to medium showers will continue until next Saturday. Residents who were out shopping and running errands were caught off guard by the sudden rainfall, causing some chaos. However, youngsters enjoyed the rain on their holiday, getting soaked and having fun.

author: TDG Network
title: 4th National Lok Adalat Of 2023: 1.17 Crore Cases Resolved - The Daily Guardian
text: The 4th National Lok Adalat of the year 2023 was organised by the legal services authorities across the country under the aegis of National Legal Services Authority, NALSA and the stewardship of Justice Sanjay Kishan Kaul, Judge, Supreme Court of India and Executive Chairman, NALSA in 34 states or Union Territories on Saturday, December 09, 2023. The Press released by the National Legal Services Authority stated that from the State Legal Services Authorities across the country as of 6:00 PM – 1,17,43,465 cases were resolved at the 4th National Lok Adalat on December 09, 2023 which includes 11,98,278 pending cases and 1,05,45,187 pre-litigation cases and the approximate value of the total settlement amount in these cases was Rs. 20,510 crores. The Press Release stated that these figures will increase further by tomorrow which is based on updated reports to be received from the State Legal Services Authorities of the country. Therefore, due to the administrative reasons, the 4th National Lok Adalat of 2023 has been scheduled in Delhi on December 10, 2023, Chhattisgarh on December 16, 2023 and the Telangana on December 30, 2023. In this Lok Adalat, the cases involve the compoundable offences, revenue cases, bank recovery cases, motor accident claims, cheque bounce cases, labour disputes, matrimonial disputes (except divorce cases), and other civil cases were taken up. The large number of recovery matters related to financial institutions, banks, government bodies and private service providers were also taken up as pre-litigation cases, and were being settled. It has also been mentioned by the press release that the resolution of cases at Lok Adalat’s allows litigants to avoid costs and delays associated with the Court based justice system and reduces case pendency of the Courts. Justice Sanjay Kishan Kaul, Judge, Supreme Court of India and Executive Chairman, NALSA, who supervised the 4th National Lok Adalat, highlighted that the swift resolution of cases at Lok Adalat’s will alleviate the immense pressure on the court system, while allowing judges to dedicate their valuable time and resources to more complex and urgent issues.

author: Ralph Edwin Villanueva
title: Ex-Blue Eagle Jared Brown cites faith in decision to turn pro | Philstar.com
text:
MANILA, Philippines – Outgoing Ateneo Blue Eagle Jared Brown said he thinks it is already “God’s plan” for him to turn pro and leave the collegiate ranks after a season in the UAAP.
Brown last week announced that he will be leaving Ateneo to possibly turn professional.
It was a surprising announcement, as this turned the shifty guard to a one-and-done prospect for the Blue Eagles, which also lost Kai Ballungay.
Ballungay also announced his decision to turn pro a few weeks ago.
“I definitely could have come back for one more year, it wasn’t really do or die but I just felt… I had the gut feeling of leaving my old school in the States for Ateneo and I really trusted God’s plan and it worked out,” Brown said in an interview aired over CNN Philippines’ Sports Desk.
“I feel like this is God’s plan for me to start my next chapter in life,” he added.
Brown earlier played for the Westmont College in California.
He then became one of the main guns for the Katipunan-based squad in UAAP Season 86.
In the elimination round, Brown averaged 9.1 points, 2.2 assists and 1.6 rebounds per game.
He helped the Blue Eagles reach the Final Four, but they were eliminated by finalists UP Fighting Maroons.
The lefty combo guard underscored that his decision was tough for him, especially since he still has one more year left.
However, he reiterated that he is ready to go pro.
“It was my first year in the UAAP, but I played for three years in the states so for me, I was getting a little older with me being 23. So I thought it was time,” he said.
The Ateneo coaching staff, including head coach Tab Baldwin, also told him that he is already ready to take the next step, the guard bared.
With the departures of Brown and Ballungay, Ateneo will be led by Chris Koon and Mason Amos in Season 87.
